sentences.sContent: There are many different cell types in the human body .
sentences.sCn: 人体中有许多种不同的细胞类型。

sentences.sContent: the power of the human mind
The desire for joy lies deep within the human spirit .
sentences.sCn: 对快乐的渴求藏在人类心灵深处。

sentences.sContent: Infra-red light is invisible to the human eye.
sentences.sCn: 红外线是人眼看不见的。

sentences.sContent: theories of human behaviour
different areas of human experience
respect for the absolute value of human life
sentences.sCn: 对人类生命绝对价值的尊重

sentences.sContent: The accident was the result of human error.
sentences.sCn: 事故是由于人为过失造成的。

sentences.sContent: The meat was declared unfit for human consumption.
sentences.sCn: 这种肉被宣布不适合人类食用。

sentences.sContent: Like humans, cats and dogs are omnivores.
sentences.sCn: 和人类一样，猫和狗是杂食性动物。

sentences.sContent: ...said the idea that aging can be cured implies the human lifespan can be increased...
...Leslie argues that curiosity is a much-overlooked human virtue...
...Boundaries exist in virtually all human relationships...
...if only we can find a way to set out human values as clear rules...
...Some robots are already programmed with basic human values...
...we figure out how to turn human values into a programmable code...
...One simple check would be to program a robot to check the correct course of action with a human when presented with an unusual situation...
...Robots could also learn values from drawing patterns from large sets of data on human behavior...
...Relationships in the real world are maintained through human contact and spending time with each other instead of chitchatting online...
...It is human nature to seek joy in life...

trans.tranOther: belonging to or relating to people, especially as opposed to machines or animals
